title: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
description: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
OB: When creating a package with a CU (Class Unit) and making the CU read-only, then attempting to rename the package, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed after the renaming process finishes.
EB: The system should check if all resources in the package are writeable before allowing the package to be renamed. If any resources are found to be read-only, the renaming operation should be blocked or an appropriate error message should be displayed.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Create a package with a Class Unit (CU) in it.
2. Make the CU read-only (non-writeable).
3. Attempt to rename the package.

Observe that after the renaming process finishes, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed.
